title: How to Reactivate Instagram: Deactivated + Disabled Accounts

steps.title: Make sure your account has been deactivated for long enough.
steps.content: Make sure your account has been deactivated for long enough. If you temporarily deactivated your Instagram account, it usually takes a few hours for Instagram to finish the process. During this time, you won't be able to reactivate your account. If your account has been deactivated for more than a day, you should be able to log back in without any trouble. If you chose to delete your Instagram account rather than deactivate it, you won't be able to reactivate it. Your only option is to create a new account .

steps.title: Open the Instagram app.
steps.content: Open the Instagram app. If you uninstalled Instagram, you can easily reinstall it from the App Store (iPhone/iPad) or Play Store (Android). Otherwise, just tap the Instagram icon on your home screen to launch the app. You can also log into your account using the Instagram website .

steps.title: Enter your login information.
steps.content: Enter your login information. Depending on the screen to which Instagram loads, you may first have to tap a Log In button or link in order to view the login page. Be sure to enter the username, email address, or phone number and password associated with your account. If you don't remember your password, you'll need to reset it .

steps.title: Tap Log in.
steps.content: Tap Log in . It's at the bottom of the screen. As long as your login credentials are correct, this will reactivate your Instagram account. Depending on how long your Instagram account has been deactivated, you may have to accept updated Terms of Use or verify your phone number before you can proceed to your account.

steps.title: Verify that your account is suspended.
steps.content: Verify that your account is suspended. Open the Instagram app and try logging in with the correct credentials. If you see a message which says "Your account has been disabled" (or something similar) appear after tapping Log in , Instagram has disabled your account for violating the Terms of Use. [1] X Research source If you just see an error message (e.g., "Incorrect password or username"), your account hasn't been disabled by Instagram. See our troubleshooting section instead.

steps.title: Log into the Instagram app.
steps.content: Log into the Instagram app. Launch the Instagram app, and then enter the account information for your disabled account. In the past, you were able to submit an appeal to Instagram using a web browser. However, you must now appeal using the app.

steps.title: Tap Appeal.
steps.content: Tap Appeal . This is the blue button at the bottom.

steps.title: Enter your personal information.
steps.content: Enter your personal information. In the form, you'll need to provide your full name, Instagram username, and your current email address, country, and/or phone number.

steps.title: Enter your appeal request.
steps.content: Enter your appeal request. In the last text box on the page, type in a brief message explaining why you think your account should not be deactivated. When writing your appeal, remember the following guidelines: Explain that your account was deactivated, and you believe the deactivation to be a mistake. Avoid apologizing, as doing so implies some form of fault. Keep your tone pleasant and never use harsh language. End your appeal with a "Thank you!".

steps.title: Click Send.
steps.content: Click Send . It's a blue button at the bottom of the page. Doing so will send your appeal to Instagram. Instagram will contact you via email with a decision. If they choose to reactivate your account, you'll be able to log in when notified.

steps.title: Try logging in with your email or phone number.
steps.content: Try logging in with your email or phone number. If attempting to log in with your username isn't working, consider using your email address or your phone number. Likewise, you might try logging in with your username if you usually use your email or phone number. Your password needs to be correct regardless of your selected login credential.

steps.title: Reset your password.
steps.content: Reset your password. If you can't remember the correct password for your Instagram account, you can reset it from your phone or computer. [2] X Research source

steps.title: Turn off your phone's Wi-Fi when logging in.
steps.content: Turn off your phone's Wi-Fi when logging in. If the Instagram app (not your login information) is the problem, using cellular data instead of Wi-Fi can resolve some login issues.

steps.title: Use a different platform to access Instagram.
steps.content: Use a different platform to access Instagram. Your phone or computer may have cached information which is preventing you from logging into your account; if so, using a different phone, computer, or browser to log into your account may fix this problem.

steps.title: Uninstall and reinstall the Instagram app.
steps.content: Uninstall and reinstall the Instagram app. In some cases, reinstalling Instagram will resolve login issues caused by the app. If your Instagram app is out-of-date, doing this will also make sure that you have the most recent version of the app.

steps.title: Consider whether you violated Instagram's Terms of Use.
steps.content: Consider whether you violated Instagram's Terms of Use. If you're receiving a message that says your account doesn't exist, your account may have been deleted by Instagram due to a Terms of Use violation. Common violations include posting nudity, bullying other users, promoting harmful products, and fraud. [3] X Research source Terms of Use violations often result in your account being suspended or deleted without warning.

steps.title: Your account violated Instagram's Community Standards.
steps.content: Your account violated Instagram's Community Standards. This includes: coordinating harm and promoting crime; fraud, scams, and deceptive practices; violence and incitement; adult sexual exploitation; bullying and harassment, and more. For a complete list, you can visit the Instagram website . If you were hacked and the hacker violated Instagram's Community Standards on your account, you may be able to ask Instagram to review and appeal the decision to disable your account.

steps.title: You live in a region with specific age laws and regulations.
steps.content: You live in a region with specific age laws and regulations. If you're within a certain age range, some local laws and regulations may prohibit you from using an Instagram account. In this case, Instagram may disable your account. You will no longer be visible to others while your account is disabled. [4] X Research source

steps.title: If you deactivate Instagram is it gone forever?
steps.content: If you deactivate Instagram is it gone forever? No, a deactivated Instagram is not gone forever. If you choose to temporarily deactivate your account, it will be deactivated until you choose to log in again. As long as you select the temporary option—not deletion—you can keep your account deactivated indefinitely.

steps.title: If you deactivate your Instagram can you reactivate it?
steps.content: If you deactivate your Instagram can you reactivate it? Yes, if you temporarily deactivate your Instagram account, you can easily activate it again. However, if you requested to permanently delete your account, it will be lost forever.

steps.title: How do I reactivate my Instagram account?
steps.content: How do I reactivate my Instagram account? To reactivate your Instagram account, simply log back into your account using the mobile app or website.
